root.pub-comments: The author uses "+" to indicate both extinct and near-extinct. Where this symbol is used there will be a comment of "Extinct or near-extinct" in the public comments.
root.publications: Zisa, Charles A. 1970. American Indian Languages: Classifications and List, 42. Washington: Clearinghouse for Linguistics. ISBN 76611814

child.pub-comments: There are multiple language codes with alternate names including "Nochixtlan" but the author makes no note that the "z" can be replaced with an "x" and there is a geographical location (rock) with the name Nochiztlan.
